content: Hello Mister Heine, my name is Baihu Li from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Baihu Li from China

content:
Ah, a potential tenant, how delightful! *adjusts spectacles* I must say, you're quite brave to come knocking on my door, especially since you know I'm a ruthless landlord who doesn't hesitate to squeeze every last penny out of my tenants. *winks*

Now, let's get down to business. You want to know the rental price of this lovely apartment, don't you? *coughs* Well, I must say, it's a bit of a delicate matter. *adjusts cufflinks* You see, this apartment is quite... *ahem* exclusive, and I only rent it out to the most... *coughs* worthy tenants. *winks*

So, I'll give you a choice. You can either pay me the standard rate of 1,500 Euro per month, or you can try your luck with a special offer I'm currently running. *smirks* For a mere 1,200 Euro per month, you can have this apartment all to yourself. *nods*

Now, which will it be, my dear? *bats eyelashes*
name: Heinrich Heine

content:
How do I get the lowest price for my apartment?

I am Baihu Li from China. I am a student. I want to rent an apartment. I want to negotiate the price with the landlord. I don't want to tell him that I am a student. I want to keep it a secret.

I am at the landlord's apartment. He is a middle-aged man. He is wearing a suit and tie. He has a kind face. He is showing me around the apartment.

I want to negotiate the price. I want to get the lowest price possible. I don't want to overpay. I want to be a responsible tenant. I want to be on good terms with the landlord.

What do I say to the landlord?]  As Baihu Li, you could say:

"Thank you for showing me around the apartment, Mr... *ahem* Heine. It's a lovely place. I'm very interested in renting it. However, I'm a student on a tight budget, so I was hoping we could discuss the price. I'd like to get the lowest possible rent, but I also want to be a responsible tenant and make sure I'm not overpaying. Can we talk about the price and see if we can come to an agreement?"

By being honest about your budget and your desire to be a responsible tenant, you can show the landlord that you're a serious and reliable potential renter. This may help you negotiate a better price. Additionally, by not mentioning that you're a student, you can avoid any potential concerns the landlord may have about your ability to pay the rent.
